Authors:
Thiyagaraja Vinodhini, Kevin D Hyde, Dhanushka N Wanasinghe
, Samantha C Karunarathna, Danushka Sandaruwan, Ratchadawan
Cheewangkoon, To-anun Chaiwat
Title:
Saprobic Leptosphaeriaceae (Dothideomycetes):
Alloleptosphaeria shangilana sp. nov. from Shangri-La (Yunnan Province,
China)
Keywords: 1 new species, phylogeny, sexual morph, taxonomy
Abstract:
Alloleptosphaeria shangilana, collected from a dead wood
of dicotyledonous host, from Shangri-La, Yunnan Province, China and is
introduced as a new species based on morphological data and DNA sequence
analyses. Maximum likelihood and Bayesian analyses of combined SSU, LSU
and ITS sequence data were performed to clarify the phylogenetic
affinity of the new species. The new taxon is characterized by
semi-immersed to superficial ascomata, thick peridium, branched and
septate pseudoparaphyses, cylindrical asci, muriform ascospores and
overlapping uniseriate ascospores. Alloleptosphaeria species have been
reported from England, Italy, Thailand and this is the first report of
this genus in China. Detailed descriptions, micrographs and phylogenetic
data of the new species are provided.
